TopicTitle: Has everyone forgotten about the fabled extra gas planets?

Articles.Content: I think that those planets would be a nice addition to the stock solar system. Not only would it mean a new and un-explored frontier for Veterans and Newbs, but it would pull the community back together again if the entire "*it's too hard for me so go back to the old way*" fiasco happens for those planets just as it did for the new atmosphere overhaul 1.0 brought. I guess they're waiting for after unity 5 or when 64bit is fixed up and ready to rumble. I don't mind if they've been canceled. I'd like to be sure though as they're planned according to the community edited Wiki page.

Yes. It's never been brought up on these forums.

![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Joking aside, I'd rather the devs spend their time giving us things to do with the worlds we already have. Currently, they're big balls of "oh do I wand to land on the dark <primary color="" of="" the="" world=""> or light <primary color="" of="" the="" world=""> area?"</primary></primary>

Adding a Jool clone with some Tylo/Vall/Pol/Bop/Laythe clones as moon doesn't sound like a good idea.

Oh dear gods not this again.

Afaik there's no plans for another gas giant, but you can always install that extra planets addon.

As far as I remember did the developer responsible for new planets leave the team. Hence, new planets are on halt.

I think more planets are a good idea, as long

 - they do not draw too much attention from other features in developement

 - they do not drain to much performance (game is slow enough already)

 - they add something new; so far each planet is totaly different. Just "gas planet 2" is to few a difference in my opinion

Nevertheless I would like to have gas planet 2 a retrograde moon or a moon with a moon or a ring. This would make it special.
I support a stock GP2

> 
> I support a stock GP2

Not empty quoting.

I support NovaSilisko's original layout for planets.

![l6zUItk.png](http://i.imgur.com/l6zUItk.png)
See those are interesting unique moons. Nova was the best.

> 
> See those are interesting unique moons. Nova was the best.

This we can agree on.

EDIT: just noticed how our sigs line up. Consider that a petition Squad.

Eeloo was suppose to a moon for Gas Giant 2, and as people have pointed out, was suppose to have functional geysers (I also read somewhere that Laythe was suppose to have volcanoes). I think the reason why Gas Giant 2 was not originally implemented was because of performance reasons, although I think that's becoming less of a reason due to increase in computer power and eventually, 64 bit support. 

While you're waiting on it, the Outer Planets Mod is a good mod to play around with.

I imagine if a mod is complaining about it, it is because there is a track record of the topic in question devolving into a problematic state somewhat quickly. That does not mean that is guaranteed and acting on that impulse is generally bad (havent seen any mod do that here in a long long time, so thats good) but it can be cause for concern and for staff to keep an eye on it, knowing it might go south.

Nah it's more the repetition, and that Squad have made absolutely no mention of more planets since NovaSilisko left the team.

I also prefer Canopus' suggestion that the existing planets be fleshed out, as what is the use of more planets if there's nothing on them?

there are mods that let you go to 1,000,000x and 10,000,000 (time control or warp unlocker). however. once you reload the ship, cracken instantly get its hands on your ship and you xplode! 

I think the way the game stores positions using doubles (~16 decimal places) is to blame since time warping 5 or 6 decimal places at a time causes too much truncation error for the computer to handle. 

It seems to me that storing planetary positions with more decimal places would fix the problem (perhaps not even moon positions just planetary positions). What's the big deal--just change them to quads?
I've found 500,000x to be a good top-end.

> 
> I've found 500,000x to be a good top-end.

it's stable with current builds? no cracken?

> 
> it's stable with current builds? no cracken?

I haven't used that in some time, but I recall it being perfectly stable in 0.23.5.

I don't particularly care for new planets, but what I would like to see is more meaningful activities to do on/near existing planets (e.g. science experiments / surface sample collection that produce actual quantifiable data instead of generic science points)

I'm in agreement that we really need more stuff to do on existing planets than we need more planets to go to, though I'm not opposed outright to the idea of spending developer time on more planets.

That said, I think Squad should definitely make sure that they've closed every detectable memory leak before spending any development time on other planets. Prioritizing any other asset management improvements/fixes that they have planned would probably also be a good thing. Adding more planets in a situation where you're already memory constrained and/or leaking memory would be bad prioritization.

Don't get me wrong, I'm not saying that they have to add dynamic asset loading or other things like that. I actually thought they came close to, if not achieved this in 1.0, but they've backslid by the time of 1.0.2, and I'm not sure that the heat gauges are the only issue.
